verses.verse: The king's <WH4428> heart <WH3820> is in the hand <WH3027> of the YY <WH3068>, as the rivers <WH6388> of water <WH4325>: he turneth <WH5186> <WH8686> it whithersoever he will <WH2654> <WH8799>.
Havahry way <WH1870> of a man <WH376> is right <WH3477> in his own eyes <WH5869>: but the YY <WH3068> pondereth <WH8505> <WH8802> the hearts <WH3826>.
To do <WH6213> <WH8800> justice <WH6666> and judgment <WH4941> is more acceptable <WH977> <WH8737> to the YY <WH3068> than sacrifice <WH2077>.
An high <WH7312> look <WH5869>, and a proud <WH7342> heart <WH3820>, and the plowing <WH5215> of the wicked <WH7563>, is sin <WH2403>.
The thoughts <WH4284> of the diligent <WH2742> tend only to plenteousness <WH4195>; but of every one that is hasty <WH213> <WH8801> only to want <WH4270>.
The getting <WH6467> of treasures <WH214> by a lying <WH8267> tongue <WH3956> is a vanity <WH1892> tossed to and fro of <WH5086> <WH8737> them that seek <WH1245> <WH8764> death <WH4194>.
The robbery <WH7701> of the wicked <WH7563> shall destroy <WH1641> <WH8799> them; because they refuse <WH3985> <WH8765> to do <WH6213> <WH8800> judgment <WH4941>.
The way <WH1870> of man <WH376> is froward <WH2019> and strange <WH2054>: but as for the pure <WH2134>, his work <WH6467> is right <WH3477>.
It is better <WH2896> to dwell <WH3427> <WH8800> in a corner <WH6438> of the housetop <WH1406>, than with a brawling <WH4079> <WH8675> <WH4066> woman <WH802> in a wide <WH2267> house <WH1004>.
The soul <WH5315> of the wicked <WH7563> desireth <WH183> <WH8765> evil <WH7451>: his neighbour <WH7453> findeth no favour <WH2603> <WH8717> in his eyes <WH5869>.

When the scorner <WH3887> <WH8801> is punished <WH6064> <WH8800>, the simple <WH6612> is made wise <WH2449> <WH8799>: and when the wise <WH2450> is instructed <WH7919> <WH8687>, he receiveth <WH3947> <WH8799> knowledge <WH1847>.

The righteous <WH6662> man wisely considereth <WH7919> <WH8688> the house <WH1004> of the wicked <WH7563>: but 'Elohim overthroweth <WH5557> <WH8764> the wicked <WH7563> for their wickedness <WH7451>.
Whoso stoppeth <WH331> <WH8801> his ears <WH241> at the cry <WH2201> of the poor <WH1800>, he also shall cry <WH7121> <WH8799> himself, but shall not be heard <WH6030> <WH8735>.
A gift <WH4976> in secret <WH5643> pacifieth <WH3711> <WH8799> anger <WH639>: and a reward <WH7810> in the bosom <WH2436> strong <WH5794> wrath <WH2534>.
It is joy <WH8057> to the just <WH6662> to do <WH6213> <WH8800> judgment <WH4941>: but destruction <WH4288> shall be to the workers <WH6466> <WH8802> of iniquity <WH205>.
The man <WH120> that wandereth <WH8582> <WH8802> out of the way <WH1870> of understanding <WH7919> <WH8687> shall remain <WH5117> <WH8799> in the congregation <WH6951> of the dead <WH7496>.
He that loveth <WH157> <WH8802> pleasure <WH8057> shall be a poor <WH4270> man <WH376>: he that loveth <WH157> <WH8802> wine <WH3196> and oil <WH8081> shall not be rich <WH6238> <WH8686>.
The wicked <WH7563> shall be a ransom <WH3724> for the righteous <WH6662>, and the transgressor <WH898> <WH8802> for the upright <WH3477>.
It is better <WH2896> to dwell <WH3427> <WH8800> in the wilderness <WH776> <WH4057>, than with a contentious <WH4079> <WH8675> <WH4066> and an angry <WH3708> woman <WH802>.
There is treasure <WH214> to be desired <WH2530> <WH8737> and oil <WH8081> in the dwelling <WH5116> of the wise <WH2450>; but a foolish <WH3684> man <WH120> spendeth it up <WH1104> <WH8762>.
He that followeth <WH7291> <WH8802> after righteousness <WH6666> and mercy <WH2617> findeth <WH4672> <WH8799> life <WH2416>, righteousness <WH6666>, and honour <WH3519>.
A wise <WH2450> man scaleth <WH5927> <WH8804> the city <WH5892> of the mighty <WH1368>, and casteth down <WH3381> <WH8686> the strength <WH5797> of the confidence <WH4009> thereof.
Whoso keepeth <WH8104> <WH8802> his mouth <WH6310> and his tongue <WH3956> keepeth <WH8104> <WH8802> his soul <WH5315> from troubles <WH6869>.
Proud <WH2086> and haughty <WH3093> scorner <WH3887> <WH8801> is his name <WH8034>, who dealeth <WH6213> <WH8802> in proud <WH2087> wrath <WH5678>.
The desire <WH8378> of the slothful <WH6102> killeth <WH4191> <WH8686> him; for his hands <WH3027> refuse <WH3985> <WH8765> to labour <WH6213> <WH8800>.
He coveteth <WH183> <WH8694> greedily <WH8378> all the day <WH3117> long: but the righteous <WH6662> giveth <WH5414> <WH8799> and spareth <WH2820> <WH8799> not.
The sacrifice <WH2077> of the wicked <WH7563> is abomination <WH8441>: how much more, when he bringeth <WH935> <WH8686> it with a wicked mind <WH2154> ?
A false <WH3577> witness <WH5707> shall perish <WH6> <WH8799>: but the man <WH376> that heareth <WH8085> <WH8802> speaketh <WH1696> <WH8762> constantly <WH5331>.
A wicked <WH7563> man <WH376> hardeneth <WH5810> <WH8689> his face <WH6440>: but as for the upright <WH3477>, he directeth <WH995> <WH8799> <WH8675> <WH3559> <WH8686> his way <WH1870>.
There is no wisdom <WH2451> nor understanding <WH8394> nor counsel <WH6098> against the YY <WH3068>.
The horse <WH5483> is prepared <WH3559> <WH8716> against the day <WH3117> of battle <WH4421>: but safety <WH8668> is of the YY <WH3068>.
